title: Blended Mathematics Modeling Project for Solving Global Sustainability Challenges

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mathematics (calculus, statistics), data analysis, and project management experience
context.additional_context: Need to strengthen mathematical modeling competencies for establishing corporate sustainability strategies. Developing team-based problem-solving skills through hybrid learning environments

learning_goals: Learners build linear/nonlinear optimization models for climate change scenarios (e.g., carbon emission limits, renewable energy transition) and use Python or MATLAB to propose solutions for allocating ≥3 resources (energy, water, raw materials) under given constraints (cost, time, environmental regulations), achieving ≥80% efficiency
Simulate carbon emission reduction targets using real corporate data and prepare analytical reports

In blended learning environments, learners use asynchronous collaboration tools (Slack, Notion, etc.) to coordinate with project team members by requesting ≥3 feedback sessions, responding within 48 hours, and updating weekly progress documents ≥2 times
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
